definition: filthy or degraded conditions resulting from neglect or lack of money
exampleSentence: The family was living in squalor .
I was shocked by the squalor of their surroundings.
While working long days in construction and nights as an Uber driver, Colmenares tried to navigate around the menace and squalor . — Melissa Sanchez, ProPublica , 30 Dec. 2025

definition: to set going : begin
to instruct in the basics of something : introduce
to admit into membership by special ceremonies
a person who is undergoing or has passed an initiation
an expert in a special field
exampleSentence: initiate a new policy
initiate tourists into the local customs

definition: to consider as beneath one's notice or respect : feel scorn and dislike for
exampleSentence: He and Julie grooved to Cuban son and jazz on NPR and loved arty films, for instance; and they distrusted big business and despised tract houses, malls, and other aesthetically unpleasing byproducts of a consumer society. — Brian C. Anderson , National Review , 13 Mar. 2006
She was despised as a hypocrite.
I despise anchovies on pizza, and I refuse to eat them!

definition: rich in respect to a particular or essential element : made less dilute or diffuse
contained or existing or happening together in a small or narrow space or area : not spread out
intense, intensive
exampleSentence: a concentrated mixture of lemonade and iced tea
when you get a private conference with that financial adviser, you get nothing but his concentrated attention
What’s more, demand for dupe products is highly concentrated at the top to just a handful of prestige brands, data from Fresha shows. — Noor Lobad, Footwear News , 13 Jan. 2026

definition: surroundings
the surrounding conditions or forces that influence or modify: as
the whole complex of factors (as soil, climate, and living things) that influence the form and the ability to survive of a plant or animal or ecological community
the social and cultural conditions that influence a person or human community
exampleSentence: living in a rural environment
a safe home environment

definition: the condition of being free from damage or defect
total honesty and sincerity
the quality or state of being complete or undivided
exampleSentence: Many were tempted by a piece of the equity action and compromised their integrity. — Bruce Nussbaum , Business Week , 28 Jan. 2002
By September, Gorbachev had told his aides that with Eastern Europe and Germany lost, the task was to defend the integrity of the Soviet Union itself. — Condoleezza Rice , Newsweek , 22 Nov. 1999
But it is stunning to hear self-appointed watchdogs of public integrity shrug their shoulders at "standard" prosecutorial practice … — Wendy Kaminer , New York Times Book Review , 22 Mar. 1998

definition: having no result or effect : useless
concerned with unimportant matters
exampleSentence: all our efforts proved futile
a futile and foolish gesture
futile pleasures

definition: lacking meaning or point : silly
exampleSentence: inane remarks about the weather

definition: lying next or near : having a border or point in common
having a vertex or a vertex and side in common
exampleSentence: a field adjacent to the road
adjacent angles
adjacent sides of a rectangle

definition: of, relating to, or coming directly from God or a god
being God or a god
directed to God or a god
extremely good : superb
having godlike qualities
exampleSentence: the divine Savior
divine worship

definition: to complain fretfully : whine
exampleSentence: Quit whinging and get on with the job.
People were whinging about the lack of service.
Trump-supporting financiers Ken Griffin and Bill Ackman have also openly whinged about the trade war’s threat to American supremacy on the world stage. — Allison Morrow, CNN Money , 30 Apr. 2025

definition: to hold back : restrain
to refuse to grant, give, or allow
to deduct (withholding tax) from income
exampleSentence: withhold an angry response
withhold permission

definition: a hidden supply or fund stored up
exampleSentence: a squirrel's hoard of nuts
keeps a hoard of empty yogurt containers in his basement workshop for storing whatnots
he's been hoarding empty yogurt containers all winter, with the intention of using them to start seedlings in the spring

definition: worn out from too much use : commonplace
exampleSentence: a hackneyed expression

definition: a playing card with one large figure in its center
a very small amount or degree
a point scored on a serve (as in tennis) that an opponent fails to touch
a golf hole made in one stroke
a combat pilot who has shot down at least five enemy airplanes
exampleSentence: within an ace of winning
the tennis player aced her opponent

definition: something that stands for something else
something real that stands for or suggests another thing that cannot in itself be pictured or shown
a letter, character, or sign used instead of a word or group of words
exampleSentence: the lion is a symbol of courage
the sign + is the symbol for addition

definition: likely to seek or enjoy companionship : affable, friendly
leading to friendliness or pleasant social relations
social entry 2
exampleSentence: sociable people

definition: a curve that is formed by a point rotating around a straight line and moving forward in a direction parallel to that line   compare double helix
exampleSentence: The authors have structured the work as a triple helix , and some of the most powerful moments occur when all three incarnations of the characters are on stage at the same time. — Theater Critic, Los Angeles Times , 9 Jan. 2026
If cottage garden is more your style than tropical jungle, consider English ivy (Hedera helix ). — Leanne Potts, Better Homes & Gardens , 6 Jan. 2026
Bands roll out double- helix DNA structures, giant stretchy tubes, PVC pipe eyes and more onto the field to augment the show. — Heather Bushman, IndyStar , 17 Nov. 2025

definition: very good or very clever at using special knowledge or skills or at getting something done
showing keen understanding
marked by deception and trickery
cute sense 2, pretty
skill sense 1, dexterity
exampleSentence: a cunning detective
a cunning observation

definition: something that deserves blame or disgrace
loss of reputation : disgrace
the act or action of disapproving
an expression of disapproval
to find fault with : blame
exampleSentence: their dirty yard is a reproach to the whole street
was beyond reproach
reproached him for his cowardice
